intro: Astracantha kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iraq. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of many leguminous species. Astracantha kurdica is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in challenging ecological conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and potentially valuable for ecological studies.
